note.body: Hello Milan and rparkins999, I would like to take this issue. I've basically figured out how to change the behaviour but not yet how to add the new setting.

events.target_title: Allow month view to default to starting with current week

note.body: Ok, thanks for the useful instructions and hints. I will of course follow the coding style-guide.

events.target_title: Calendar: Start Month View with current week
Calendar: Start Month View with current week

note.body:
Thanks you for reviewing the patch.
## Dependency of the settings (scroll... start-month...)
If scroll-month-by-week is disabled it also works. It initializes the Month View starting from current week independent of scroll-month-by-week being true or false. In the issue it was decided to leave the settings (scroll-month-by-week, start-month-with-current-week) independent.

## List View range being coupled with Month View range
I'm not sure how it is perceived/accepted by the users of List View. The List View shows the same range as Month View. 
- Until now: Upon initialization the List View shows the entire List of events for the range of the month. 
- From now on (if start-month-with-current-week is set) it will not show events from passed weeks. That could be perceived as 'missing information' or as regression for people who are used to see the entire month in List View. The new setting doesn't state explicitly that List View is also affected.

On the other hand it looks like Month View and List View being coupled in this way is established behaviour and deviating from it could also be perceived as inconsistent/regression. Therefore I left the coupled behaviour as is with the intention of maintaining consistency and to keep things simple.

events.target_title: Calendar: Start Month View with current week

events.target_title: confusing "huge arrows" and "dots which sometimes are where spaces are and sometimes not" without options to disable these features (which names could explain features meaning)

note.body:
I'm sorry for being rude but IMHO this is a mess. I cannot explain to myself anything of this. Well actually I can some because I've created these files. But if I were to look at just the diffs I won't be able to understand what is going on and where are the important changes. And I cannot disable it. There is "Show whitespaces" option but there are also these dots inn 9_vs_10.png which is confusing - some spaces are shown as dots, some as nothing (and in 7_vs_8.png they are everywhere where spaces are, so what is the purpose of "Show whitespaces" option?).

I'm using:

OS: Linux 5.4.14-2-MANJARO #1 SMP PREEMPT Fri Jan 24 09:34:16 UTC 2020 x86_64 GNU/Linux

Meld version: 3.20.1, installed using pacman.

What is confusing me:

Why there is this arrow in diff between 1.txt and 2.txt? There is nothing in 2.txt at all, the whole files differ.

* Also, why is is so huge?
* The whole too chunks differ, what is the purpose of the array anyway?
* Does it represent '\n'? There is no arrow after the second line, so I first thought that. Nope.. See 5.txt and 5_vs_6.txt. There is an '\n' but the last huge arrow is not there. 

[1.txt](/uploads/3c6270b5dfe9338d251a21285ab58810/1.txt)

[2.txt](/uploads/b797c1242843ae1adc7bb4855aabf4c2/2.txt)

![1_vs_2](/uploads/a068e574b768c78dd7503199eb21ab3e/1_vs_2.png)

In diff between 3.txt and 4.txt they are of different size. One may think that 'this other arrow which is not that strange arrow" is a 'tab' and a dot is a 'space' and that's true but why first arrow is such small? Well actually that I can understand. Because the number of spaces is not NxTAB_size, but seeing it the first time I would've confused this 'tab arrow' with 'huge arrow' (I'm calling it that way as I cannot find another word for it, I don't understand what it mean).

Please don't understand me wrong I'm totally for the "tab arrow", it's useful and it can be understood. But it is easy to confuse it with "huge arrow". I also don't understand "dot which is not always where spaces is".

If there were preferences like:

* Show black hole diameter as huge arrow
* Show distribution of free memory blocks on the heap as a dot

I would've at least known what it was.

[3.txt](/uploads/c541703bbd45fb4e8d12bd3ecd56b99d/3.txt)

[4.txt](/uploads/82ef383dfe03a9e67c8807aa95799240/4.txt)

![3_vs_4](/uploads/12aeb1e8569ef6df5ae45d9f1de0582a/3_vs_4.png)

What is the purpose of this arrow in 5_vs_6.png? I can see without it that there are empty lines on the right and something on the left. The chunk is is one file and is not in another, it is enough to mark it as it was before, the arrow does not add any information to this, just clutters the diff. 

Also there are actually no difference in line endings, both end with '\n' it's just that one has 'y' in it and one is empty. I would've been able to see that before the feature.

[5.txt](/uploads/4d742a10616445b0a02beab31f8e16a3/5.txt)

[6.txt](/uploads/bed9b496040e0dde39d56b1d5dc0a87f/6.txt)

![5_vs_6](/uploads/efa9ef7b0c2428ea459bc1cc7660ee22/5_vs_6.png)

Regarding dots. Please check 7.txt vs 8.txt. Dots are where spaces are while whole chunks differ. What's the purpose of the dots then? "Show whitespaces" is off - so why there are dots? Also please confront that with 9_vs_10.png.

[7.txt](/uploads/6a623ba7ef43f2b2001cacbc2972b98b/7.txt)

[8.txt](/uploads/269dab8aadf640b5d398a6e9550e4093/8.txt)

![7_vs_8](/uploads/5e75a37603297251e733ab2d7038733b/7_vs_8.png)

Regarding "Without seeing the other side it's difficult to comment", please find 9.txt and 10.txt and 9_vs_10.png screenshot. I totally cannot say anything here because I don't understand what is going on at all except that it does not give me any more ideas of what actually differs than if there where no dots nor "huge arrows" at all. Seems random at first glance. I'm sure it is not, but it is confusing and not helpful at all.

[9.txt](/uploads/20215bd4b1ae4ede394cce63a22f5c51/9.txt)

[10.txt](/uploads/4911236f8632e0600f52cfe1d4746127/10.txt)

![9_vs_10](/uploads/0ab012f76d1870ec29ea9b7a8be4aade/9_vs_10.png)

If this existed I would not need any "huge arrows" to understand that I need to do some cosmetics.

Regarding the strange dots which sometimes are and sometimes they are not as in 9_vs_10.png:

https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/meld/uploads/0ab012f76d1870ec29ea9b7a8be4aade/9_vs_10.png

This seems as a totally different feature to me but is somehow relates to the "huge arrows". I'm totally confused. As I think many users might be also.

Again sorry for being rude and not specific enough in the first place.

note.body:
No, unfortunately I have not had time to test that suggestion yet, I still have to try building Evolution at all. This *is* my intent but I have tons of other things to do unfortunately.

I think it is less of a problem that some things would be hidden in the date selector, since there is a possibility to select date using the toolbar too. It would be much simpler to have a partially visible date selector than having to remove the sidebar altogether (press F9) to enable maximize-right. 

Incidentally, the intended behavior after fixing the GNOME Shell bug is already available: press F9, maximize-right, F9.

I'll do what I can but I doubt I can spend more time on this for at least a week. (I first need to find the definition of the widget. After having tried building myself.) (edit: add keypresses)

events.target_title: Calendar: Allow minicalendar shrink below its minimum size

note.body:
I have a 16x9 1920x1080 laptop with a left-hand dock that uses 32x32 icons. I would have thought Evolution would have plenty of room but apparently not. There is lots of whitespace in the minicalendar.

I am quite amazed Evolution refuses maximize-right, honestly.

events.target_title: Calendar: Allow minicalendar shrink below its minimum size

note.body:
I wonder if this is not a bug in Evolution after all. I have the following behavior: 
1. Start Evolution in email view (this can be achieved by closing it in email view).
2. Maximize-right works.
3. Maximize the window and change to calendar view.
4. Maximize-right does not work.
5. Changing back to email view does not help, maximize-right never works again until after restart.

Do I report this in the bug report?

note.body:
Hi,
I'm not sure if this is the right thread but I have installed this app through flatpak on my manjaro machine (wm is i3) and I'm running into some error regarding the screenshot qr reader:

gi.repository.GLib.Error: g-dbus-error-quark: GDBus.Error:org.freedesktop.DBus.Error.ServiceUnknown: The name org.gnome.Shell.Screenshot was not provided by any .service files (2)
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/app/lib/python3.7/site-packages/Authenticator/widgets/accounts/add.py", line 236, in scan_qr
    filename = GNOMEScreenshot.area()
  File "/app/lib/python3.7/site-packages/Authenticator/models/screenshot.py", line 56, in area
    -1, None).unpack()

I thought flatpak is installing all deps I need for this. Am I wrong?

Thanks in advance

note.body:
Hi,
I'm not sure if this is the right thread but I have installed this app through flatpak on my manjaro machine (wm is i3) and I'm running into some error regarding the screenshot qr reader:

gi.repository.GLib.Error: g-dbus-error-quark: GDBus.Error:org.freedesktop.DBus.Error.ServiceUnknown: The name org.gnome.Shell.Screenshot was not provided by any .service files (2)
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/app/lib/python3.7/site-packages/Authenticator/widgets/accounts/add.py", line 236, in scan_qr
    filename = GNOMEScreenshot.area()
  File "/app/lib/python3.7/site-packages/Authenticator/models/screenshot.py", line 56, in area
    -1, None).unpack()

I thought flatpak is installing all deps I need for this. Am I wrong?

Thanks in advance

large file throughput via gvfs-smb is over 2x slower than smbclient or fstab mount.cifs

note.body:
I am facing the same issue using gvfs 1.42.2 on Manjaro Gnome:

using the tool tinyMediaManager to read my media library from my NAS results in a very poor performance if the share is mounted via gvfs. I've stopped the whole runtime of reading my library with gvfs and mount.cifs:

gvfs: 46 minutes  
mount.cifs: 23 minutes

events.target_title: wildcard not recognised?

note.body: Is there any hope, that wildcards will be supported in future?

events.target_title: Restore to another directory
Previous versions window
Backup Failed - Could not understand Duplicity Version

note.body:
Unfortunately, I have the same problem with Deja Dup from snap (v40.6) on Linux Mint 18.3. First, I installed Deja Dup from apt and everything works, but it was a old version, so I switched to snap - and this cannot understand duplicity version.

There is one hint: when starting from terminal, before this error there is a log 
`python3: /lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libc.so.6: version GLIBC_2.25 not found (required by python3)`

So I suppose that the problem is with python that runs on my machine (because Deja Dup snap doesn't provide own version of python, right?)

events.target_title: add prefix to duplicity to extend the command

note.body:
This is so good improvement, but in my opinion*, injecting raw prefix by env isn't the best solution. Rather as for me, let's Deja Dup having own settings specifically to limiting bandwidth based on `nice` or `trickle`  (or simply injecting prefix). Anyway, it could be a few settings/variants for both or more, and single place where prefix will be build from all possibilities. 

Limiting bandwidth is so useful feature and I dare say it could in future come as setting configurable by UI. 

\* To be clear, I'm not from this project's team or any GNOME-project.

Backup Failed - Could not understand Duplicity Version

note.body:
Unfortunately, I have the same problem with Deja Dup from snap (v40.6) on Linux Mint 18.3. First, I installed Deja Dup from apt and everything works, but it was a old version, so I switched to snap - and this cannot understand duplicity version.

There is one hint: when starting from terminal, before this error there is a log 
`python3: /lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libc.so.6: version GLIBC_2.25 not found (required by python3)`

So I suppose that the problem is with python that runs on my machine (because Deja Dup snap doesn't provide own version of python, right?)

events.target_title: add prefix to duplicity to extend the command

note.body:
This is so good improvement, but in my opinion*, injecting raw prefix by env isn't the best solution. Rather as for me, let's Deja Dup having own settings specifically to limiting bandwidth based on `nice` or `trickle`  (or simply injecting prefix). Anyway, it could be a few settings/variants for both or more, and single place where prefix will be build from all possibilities. 

Limiting bandwidth is so useful feature and I dare say it could in future come as setting configurable by UI. 

\* To be clear, I'm not from this project's team or any GNOME-project.

events.target_title: Using search for keyboard navigation of remote filesystems is painfully slow

note.body:
I used nautilus to navigate ssh folders daily and I can feel the pain too due to slowness. Recently an update superseded the one provided by Lubomir Brindza's ppa and my first task for today is to downgrade all the necesary only to desperately get this working again.

I think the gnome people are mostly blind here, the absence of recent complains about type-ahead is not because of requirements met but because other people are offering patched versions that make nautilus usable again.

note.body:
I misspoke: it is not a gtk2 bug. Adwaita theme is on fault and this has repercussions on Ubuntu's default theme Yaru which is based on.

For exemple HighContrast theme doesn't affected :

![out2](/uploads/5c4895a6e793ffc2d0588a3fda1a45e2/out2.gif)

note.body:
So a fix isn't possible ?

I don't think Gimp 3.0 is coming out soon (and what about backware compatibility).

events.target_title: Qt5 apps on Manjaro use the wrong Bold face or generate a synthetic one
Qt5 apps on Manjaro use the wrong Bold face or generate a synthetic one

note.body:
Prior to updating manjaro VM yesterday the default font which is set to "Cantarell Regular 10" (never changed) was displayed as a regular font in double commander and konsole.  The cantarell-fonts package prior to installion was version 1:0.111-1.   The update included cantarell-fonts package version 1:0.201-1.  After the installation text started looking bold.  No changes to default font setting were made and it is still set to "Cantarell Regular 10".

To illustrate better, I'm attaching screenshots. They are divided into 3 categories: before, during and after the installation.

Hopefully I've provided enough information. If you need more let me know.

Thanks!

Before installation:

![manjaro_vm_cantarell-fonts_1_0.111-1_pamac](/uploads/1f7f80967e38c60c0bdf914b216fef81/manjaro_vm_cantarell-fonts_1_0.111-1_pamac.png)

![manjaro_vm_cantarell-fonts_1_0.111-1_fonts_settings](/uploads/0f0547909c5c229e82f366f91e1ce1db/manjaro_vm_cantarell-fonts_1_0.111-1_fonts_settings.png)

As you can see file names and folder names appear completely normal.

![manjaro_vm_cantarell-fonts_1_0.111-1_double_commander](/uploads/7e9a59b493310cf2eb7d151f7249f2de/manjaro_vm_cantarell-fonts_1_0.111-1_double_commander.png)

![manjaro_vm_cantarell-fonts_1_0.111-1_konsole_config](/uploads/10e2ba5516eb667dbd38e913f1f6ed39/manjaro_vm_cantarell-fonts_1_0.111-1_konsole_config.png)

During installation:

And here are some anomalies I noticed while during the font package installation. These were cleared by restarting pamac.

![manjaro_vm_during_font_installation1](/uploads/ad564e53264a96f4608c08054bb11484/manjaro_vm_during_font_installation1.png)

![manjaro_vm_during_font_installation2](/uploads/5de7bc2bcb8a78875f0189fed53175a8/manjaro_vm_during_font_installation2.png)

![manjaro_vm_during_font_installation3](/uploads/f5de2a4515f1d6662f61def77e773a08/manjaro_vm_during_font_installation3.png)

After the installation:
After VM reboot file names and folder names in double commander as well as menu labels under konsole preferences display in bold.  This is while the font settings still show "Cantarell Regular 10". I doubt this was an intentional change.

![manjaro_vm_cantarell-fonts_1_0.201-1_font_settings](/uploads/a5dafb4f3b80b4f5fd6c9b204ee95262/manjaro_vm_cantarell-fonts_1_0.201-1_font_settings.png)

![manjaro_vm_cantarell-fonts_1_0.201-1_pamac](/uploads/83fd883823bb7c579f37b24fc452423b/manjaro_vm_cantarell-fonts_1_0.201-1_pamac.png)

![manjaro_vm_cantarell-fonts_1_0.201-1_double_commander](/uploads/75fd33fe2900edc2e7482c6856d0edf2/manjaro_vm_cantarell-fonts_1_0.201-1_double_commander.png)

![manjaro_vm_cantarell-fonts_1_0.201-1_konsole_config](/uploads/c0b6e82db70e75bc891e78845e64f981/manjaro_vm_cantarell-fonts_1_0.201-1_konsole_config.png)

events.target_title: Qt5 apps on Manjaro use the wrong Bold face or generate a synthetic one

note.body:
Yes it's a Qt5 issue only GTK version of double commander is fine. Deleting Cantarell-VF.otf does fix the problem.  Also I did notice that the issue is with the Cantarell bold font, not the regular as I said initially.  Double commander uses cantarell bold 10 as a main font by default. It looks like the bold font got a lot bolder with v0.201 update.  For my situation I could just change the font to regular in double commander or as you mentioned delete Cantarell-VF.otf file. I don't like either of these options since: 

 * a) I have to apply either fix to over a dozen VMs 
 * b) If I delete Cantarell-VF.otf file a new update will simply put it back and I'll have to delete it again... 
 * c) If I fix it in double commander it may not be fixed in other applications.  

So it would be very useful to know if this change was intentional or not? If not will this issue be fixed in the next update?
Thank you!

events.target_title: Qt5 apps on Manjaro use the wrong Bold face or generate a synthetic one

note.body:
I searched before reporting the problem and saw nothing recent. The theme/style I'm using under Qt5 config is cleanlooks.  I tried several other available themes and it appears theme selection does not affect font boldness.

Qt5 - 5.14.0-3
FreeType2 - 2.10.1-1

 * b) If I delete Cantarell-VF.otf file a new update will simply put it back and I'll have to delete it again... 
 * c) If I fix it in double commander it may not be fixed in other applications.  

So it would be very useful to know if this change was intentional or not? If not will this issue be fixed in the next update?
Thank you!

events.target_title: Qt5 apps on Manjaro use the wrong Bold face or generate a synthetic one

note.body:

Also I did notice that the issue is with the Cantarell bold font, not the regular as I said initially.  Double commander uses cantarell bold 10 as a main font by default. It looks like the bold font got a lot bolder with v0.201 update.  For my situation I could just change the font to regular in double commander or as you mentioned delete Cantarell-VF.otf file. I don't like either of these options since: 

 * a) I have to apply either fix to over a dozen VMs 
 * b) If I delete Cantarell-VF.otf file a new update will simply put it back and I'll have to delete it again... 
 * c) If I fix it in double commander it may not be fixed in other applications.  

So it would be very useful to know if this change was intentional or not? If not will this issue be fixed in the next update?
Thank you!

note.body:
Prior to updating manjaro VM yesterday the default font which is set to "Cantarell Regular 10" (never changed) was displayed as a regular font in double commander and konsole.  The cantarell-fonts package prior to installion was version 1:0.111-1.   The update included cantarell-fonts package version 1:0.201-1.  After the installation text started looking bold.  No changes to default font setting were made and it is still set to "Cantarell Regular 10".

To illustrate better, I'm attaching screenshots. They are divided into 3 categories: before, during and after the installation.

Hopefully I've provided enough information. If you need more let me know.

Thanks!

Before installation:

![manjaro_vm_cantarell-fonts_1_0.111-1_pamac](/uploads/1f7f80967e38c60c0bdf914b216fef81/manjaro_vm_cantarell-fonts_1_0.111-1_pamac.png)

![manjaro_vm_cantarell-fonts_1_0.111-1_fonts_settings](/uploads/0f0547909c5c229e82f366f91e1ce1db/manjaro_vm_cantarell-fonts_1_0.111-1_fonts_settings.png)

As you can see file names and folder names appear completely normal.

![manjaro_vm_cantarell-fonts_1_0.111-1_double_commander](/uploads/7e9a59b493310cf2eb7d151f7249f2de/manjaro_vm_cantarell-fonts_1_0.111-1_double_commander.png)

![manjaro_vm_cantarell-fonts_1_0.111-1_konsole_config](/uploads/10e2ba5516eb667dbd38e913f1f6ed39/manjaro_vm_cantarell-fonts_1_0.111-1_konsole_config.png)

During installation:

And here are some anomalies I noticed while during the font package installation. These were cleared by restarting pamac.

![manjaro_vm_during_font_installation1](/uploads/ad564e53264a96f4608c08054bb11484/manjaro_vm_during_font_installation1.png)

![manjaro_vm_during_font_installation2](/uploads/5de7bc2bcb8a78875f0189fed53175a8/manjaro_vm_during_font_installation2.png)

![manjaro_vm_during_font_installation3](/uploads/f5de2a4515f1d6662f61def77e773a08/manjaro_vm_during_font_installation3.png)

After the installation:
After VM reboot file names and folder names in double commander as well as menu labels under konsole preferences display in bold.  This is while the font settings still show "Cantarell Regular 10". I doubt this was an intentional change.

![manjaro_vm_cantarell-fonts_1_0.201-1_font_settings](/uploads/a5dafb4f3b80b4f5fd6c9b204ee95262/manjaro_vm_cantarell-fonts_1_0.201-1_font_settings.png)

![manjaro_vm_cantarell-fonts_1_0.201-1_pamac](/uploads/83fd883823bb7c579f37b24fc452423b/manjaro_vm_cantarell-fonts_1_0.201-1_pamac.png)

![manjaro_vm_cantarell-fonts_1_0.201-1_double_commander](/uploads/75fd33fe2900edc2e7482c6856d0edf2/manjaro_vm_cantarell-fonts_1_0.201-1_double_commander.png)

![manjaro_vm_cantarell-fonts_1_0.201-1_konsole_config](/uploads/c0b6e82db70e75bc891e78845e64f981/manjaro_vm_cantarell-fonts_1_0.201-1_konsole_config.png)

events.target_title: canterell-fonts v0.201

note.body:
Yes it's a Qt5 issue only GTK version of double commander is fine. Deleting Cantarell-VF.otf does fix the problem.  Also I did notice that the issue is with the Cantarell bold font, not the regular as I said initially.  Double commander uses cantarell bold 10 as a main font by default. It looks like the bold font got a lot bolder with v0.201 update.  For my situation I could just change the font to regular in double commander or as you mentioned delete Cantarell-VF.otf file. I don't like either of these options since: 

 * a) I have to apply either fix to over a dozen VMs 
 * b) If I delete Cantarell-VF.otf file a new update will simply put it back and I'll have to delete it again... 
 * c) If I fix it in double commander it may not be fixed in other applications.  

So it would be very useful to know if this change was intentional or not? If not will this issue be fixed in the next update?
Thank you!

events.target_title: canterell-fonts v0.201

note.body:
I searched before reporting the problem and saw nothing recent. The theme/style I'm using under Qt5 config is cleanlooks.  I tried several other available themes and it appears theme selection does not affect font boldness.

Qt5 - 5.14.0-3
FreeType2 - 2.10.1-1

events.target_title: When copying a text layer, paste should create a new text layer, not an image of the text

note.body: I just installed 2.10 on OS X to get past this problem, and it still does not work for me. I have an editable text layer in an image, and when I copy it to another image, either by copy/paste or by having it be the only visible layer and dragging the info box from the selected tab to the canvas of the other, I get the text but clicking it with the text tool only gives me the information (font, size, etc.) but will not edit it.

I have an editable text layer in an image, and when I copy it to another image, either by copy/paste or by having it be the only visible layer and dragging the info box from the selected tab to the canvas of the other, I get the text but clicking it with the text tool only gives me the information (font, size, etc.) but will not edit it.

events.target_title: pdf files are rendered but not printed

note.body:
I have a very similar situation, I use Ubuntu 19.10 with Evince 3.34.1 and a new Epson ET-2720 printer.
The Epson prints: Test pages, office documents and PDFs printed with LibreOffice Draw. If I send PDFs to the printer with Evince, Ubuntu will state the print job has been sent to the printer, the Epson printer indicates it receives the document, tries to processes it, then stops abruptly, finally Ubuntu states the print job has completed.
I also have an older HP OfficeJet Pro 8710. If I use Evince to sent the same test PDFs to this printer it is capable of processing and printing the information Evince generated.
These events are a strong indication that Evince unsuccessfully implements some printing standards.

note.body: I just used the default programs editor app and re-established gimp as the default program.

events.target_title: Cannot open images with non English characters from the file explorer

note.body: No error messages just the mouse cursor changing as if it were loading a program then it stops and gimp does not open. I have asked my friend if it was okay to share the photos but he declined the request. However he sent me an image that has foreign characters for me to test and it too won't open from the file explorer. Note the image is the same format as the photos I am trying to open.![課題中_勉強背景](/uploads/140d76e6c469505df008f5c512860446/課題中_勉強背景.png)

events.target_title: Cannot open images with non English characters from the file explorer

note.body: New development. I have found a way to open the images outside of GIMP. For some reason or another if I open the image from my desktop the image will open up and load into GIMP. However the moment I place it into a folder and try to open it, GIMP refuses to open and load the image with no error prompts.

events.target_title: Cannot open images with non English characters from the file explorer

note.body:
Yes, if I rename them to have only english or numbers I am able to open
them from the file explorer. The exact steps I do are simply right click
and open with default program which is currently set to gimp. I don't know
exactly why I can open non english files on the desktop but not the file
explorer.

events.target_title: Cannot open images with non English characters from the file explorer

note.body:
I am also using the english version of gimp, it's just the files supplied
to me are in japanese

note.body:
I have possibly a similar issue running gnome-boxes on Ubuntu 19.10 with Plasma.

Launching gnome-boxes, the main window opens and show a loading animation, then after a few seconds it crashes.

Running in the console I get this output:

```
$ gnome-boxes

(gnome-boxes:29184): Gtk-WARNING **: 11:32:42.048: GtkFlowBox with a model will ignore sort and filter functions

(gnome-boxes:29184): Gtk-WARNING **: 11:32:42.049: GtkListBox with a model will ignore sort and filter functions

(gnome-boxes:29184): Boxes-WARNING **: 11:32:45.344: util-app.vala:178: Failed to find OS with id: 'http://endlessos.com/eos/3.6': Unknown OS ID 'http://endlessos.com/eos/3.6'

(gnome-boxes:29184): Boxes-WARNING **: 11:32:45.351: util-app.vala:178: Failed to find OS with id: 'http://endlessos.com/eos/3.6': Unknown OS ID 'http://endlessos.com/eos/3.6'

(gnome-boxes:29184): Boxes-WARNING **: 11:32:45.465: util-app.vala:178: Failed to find OS with id: 'http://endlessos.com/eos/3.6': Unknown OS ID 'http://endlessos.com/eos/3.6'

(gnome-boxes:29184): Boxes-WARNING **: 11:32:46.125: libvirt-machine.vala:83: Failed to disable 3D Acceleration

(gnome-boxes:29184): Boxes-WARNING **: 11:32:46.134: libvirt-broker.vala:66: Failed to update domain 'ubuntu18.10-3': Failed to set domain configuration: XML error: Invalid PCI address 0000:04:00.0. slot must be >= 1

(gnome-boxes:29184): Libvirt.GObject-CRITICAL **: 11:32:46.902: gvir_storage_vol_get_path: assertion 'GVIR_IS_STORAGE_VOL(vol)' failed

(gnome-boxes:29184): Boxes-WARNING **: 11:32:46.906: libvirt-machine.vala:83: Failed to disable 3D Acceleration

(gnome-boxes:29184): Boxes-WARNING **: 11:32:46.913: libvirt-broker.vala:66: Failed to update domain 'ubuntu18.10-3-2': Failed to set domain configuration: XML error: Invalid PCI address 0000:04:00.0. slot must be >= 1

(gnome-boxes:29184): Boxes-WARNING **: 11:32:46.914: libvirt-broker.vala:159: Failed to find source machine of clone develop 1201

(gnome-boxes:29184): Boxes-CRITICAL **: 11:32:46.914: boxes_vm_importer_get_source_media: assertion 'self != NULL' failed
Segmentation fault (core dumped)
```

Using gdb on the resulting core shows this:

    at ../csu/libc-start.c:308
#24 0x00005630b1318ece in _start () at src/25a6634@@gnome-boxes@exe/main.c:513
```

removing `~/.cache/gnome-boxes` and `~/.config/gnome-boxes` makes it crash faster, without any change in the gdb back trace or console output.

removing `~/.config/libvirt` and `~/.cache/libvirt` causes gnome-boxes to load properly.

note.body:
Is there anything I, as a normal end user with some basic programming skills, can do to give this more traction? This bug has been reported multiple times since gnome got wayland support.
This is the first one, I think: [https://bugzilla.gnome.org/show_bug.cgi?id=739718](https://bugzilla.gnome.org/show_bug.cgi?id=739718)

I would love to help out. This is basically all that's keeping me from moving to wayland.

"No stylus found" displayed in GNOME settings on Thinkpad X1 Yoga.

note.body: I have the same issue on my ThinkPad L380 Yoga. GNOME Settings says "No stylus found" but everything works just fine.

events.target_title: "No stylus found" displayed in GNOME settings on Thinkpad X1 Yoga.

note.body:
`libwacom-list-local-devices` says

```
~ $ libwacom-list-local-devices
# Device node: /dev/input/event6
[Device]
Name=Wacom ISDv4 5157
ModelName=
DeviceMatch=usb:056a:5157;
Class=ISDV4
Width=12
Height=7
IntegratedIn=Display;System;
Styli=0xffffe;0xfffff;

[Features]
Reversible=false
Stylus=true
Ring=false
Ring2=false
Touch=true
TouchSwitch=false
# StatusLEDs=
NumStrips=0
Buttons=0

---------------------------------------------------------------
# Device node: /dev/input/event5
[Device]
Name=Wacom ISDv4 5157
ModelName=
DeviceMatch=usb:056a:5157;
Class=ISDV4
Width=12
Height=7
IntegratedIn=Display;System;
Styli=0xffffe;0xfffff;

[Features]
Reversible=false
Stylus=true
Ring=false
Ring2=false
Touch=true
TouchSwitch=false
# StatusLEDs=
NumStrips=0
Buttons=0

---------------------------------------------------------------
```
for me. I found a corresponding entry under `/usr/share/libwacom`. It's

```
~ $ cat /usr/share/libwacom/isdv4-5157.tablet 
# this is for the Wacom pen + touchscreen as found in some versions of the Lenovo ThinkPad L380 Yoga

[Device]
Name=Wacom ISDv4 5157
ModelName=
DeviceMatch=usb:056a:5157;
Class=ISDV4
Width=12
Height=7
IntegratedIn=Display;System;

[Features]
Stylus=true
Touch=true
Buttons=0
```

My Stylus has two buttons, maybe that's one issue?

events.target_title: "No stylus found" displayed in GNOME settings on Thinkpad X1 Yoga.

note.body:
Ok, I found the issue (at least for me). The stylus needs a separate definition (within `/usr/share/libwacom/libwacom.stylus`). So this is (again, at least for me) a libwacom "bug". You can fix it by searching for the ID of the stylus in `libinput record` (do something with the stylus). It appears in the first line containing `ABS_MISC` like this:

```
    - [18446744073139, 488051,   3,  40,      17] # EV_ABS / ABS_MISC                 17
```

17 is the ID in this case. Convert it to hexadecimal and add an entry to `libwacom.stylus` like that:

```
[0x11]
Name=ThinkPad Pen
HasEraser=false
Buttons=2
Axes=Pressure;Distance;
Type=General
```

(`0x11` is 7 in hexadecimal)

Maybe you also have to find your tablets definition and add this ID as `Styli=0x11` there to indicate that this is a supported stylus. But I don't know whether that was necessary to get it working. And you should file an issue at https://github.com/linuxwacom/libwacom to get your stylus included in the next release.

(`0x11` is 7 in hexadecimal)

Maybe you also have to find your tablets definition and add this ID as `Styli=0x11` there to indicate that this is a supported stylus. But I don't know whether that was necessary to get it working. And you should file an issue at https://github.com/linuxwacom/libwacom to get your stylus included in the next release.

---------------------------------------------------------------
```
for me. I found a corresponding entry under `/usr/share/libwacom`. It's

```
~ $ cat /usr/share/libwacom/isdv4-5157.tablet 
# this is for the Wacom pen + touchscreen as found in some versions of the Lenovo ThinkPad L380 Yoga

[Device]
Name=Wacom ISDv4 5157
ModelName=
DeviceMatch=usb:056a:5157;
Class=ISDV4
Width=12
Height=7
IntegratedIn=Display;System;

[Features]
Stylus=true
Touch=true
Buttons=0
```

My Stylus has two buttons, maybe that's one issue?

events.target_title: "No stylus found" displayed in GNOME settings on Thinkpad X1 Yoga.

note.body:
Ok, I found the issue (at least for me). The stylus needs a separate definition (within `/usr/share/libwacom/libwacom.stylus`). So this is (again, at least for me) a libwacom "bug". You can fix it by searching for the ID of the stylus in `libinput record` (do something with the stylus). It appears in the first line containing `ABS_MISC` like this:

```
    - [18446744073139, 488051,   3,  40,      17] # EV_ABS / ABS_MISC                 17
```

17 is the ID in this case. Convert it to hexadecimal and add an entry to `libwacom.stylus` like that:

```
[0x11]
Name=ThinkPad Pen
HasEraser=false
Buttons=2
Axes=Pressure;Distance;
Type=General
```

(`0x11` is 7 in hexadecimal)

Maybe you also have to find your tablets definition and add this ID as `Styli=0x11` there to indicate that this is a supported stylus. But I don't know whether that was necessary to get it working. And you should file an issue at https://github.com/linuxwacom/libwacom to get your stylus included in the next release.

events.target_title: spinning-globe does't work

note.body:
*Windows 10, Gimp 2.10.14*

Is there a fix I should be downloading somewhere in the git tree? 

I looked at #4331 and it looked like that issue was fixed in 2.10.14 which is the version I'm seeing this error on. E.g. it seems as if it's broken in the current release as well.

Just in case it might help, I'm adding the specific error message:

*Filters>Animation>Spinning Globe...*

```
GIMP Message
Plug-in crashed: "map-object.exe"
(C:\Program Files\GIMP 2\lib\gimp\2.0\plug-ins\map-object\map-object.exe)

The dying plug-in may have messed up GIMP's internal state. You may want to save your images and restart GIMP to be on the safe side.

Spinning Globe Message
Error while executing script-fu-spinning-globe:

Error: Procedure execution of plug-in-map-object failed on invalid input arguments: Procedure 'plug-in-map-object' returned no return values 
```

I can also run any debug you might need if you cannot duplicate the behavior.

events.target_title: Wrong time(zone?) in calendar events

note.body:
```
$ gnome-calendar --version
gnome-calendar: Version 3.34.2
$ pacman -Q libical
libical 3.0.7-1
```

Calendar with this issue: https://filmkreis.de/kalender

This calendar uses the `X-WR-TIMEZONE` property.

My timezone is Europe/Berlin (CET). The events on Tuesdays and Thursdays start at 20:00 hours but are displayed at 21:00 hours.

If I change the timezone to EET the event is displayed at 22:00 hours. If I change the timezone to GMT the event is displayed at 20:00 hours.

To me this appears to be an off-by-one error. The event should always be displayed one hour earlier than it actually is.

events.target_title: Allow disabling "automatic mark as read"
Geary attachment warning matchers not translated to  German

note.body:
The attachment warning markers are already translated. Currently Geary warns for the following German words: "Anhang|Anhänge|angehängt|anhängen|Wiedervorlage|Beilage|beilegen|Anlage|anbei|beigefügt|anhängend" (the vertical pipe is used as a separator)

I can confirm that this is working well in Geary 3.34.2 if the user interface is set to German.

So this issue should be closed.

[PDF import] Keep the file names

note.body:
This would be a really useful feature.
For example it would allow to easier find files on systems where Paperwork isn't installed.
In addition it would allow to easily migrate away from Paperwork. Not that this would ever be needed ;).

events.target_title: [PDF import] Keep the file names

note.body:
I wouldn't worry to much about a user adding files to the folder.
I reckon most users will import the PDFs through Paperwork but would like to keep their naming system.
In my case:
YYYY-MM-DD_some_name.pdf
I wouldn't store any other files in the folder Paperwork creates I just would like to have useful filenames outside of Paperwork.
E.g. when using Nextcloud on my phone.
A hacky way would be to just look for *.pdf in a folder.
Sure that could break if there are more than one PDF but IMO better than nothing.

A hacky way would be to just look for *.pdf in a folder.
Sure that could break if there are more than one PDF but IMO better than nothing.

events.target_title: [PDF import] Keep the file names

note.body:
This would be a really useful feature.
For example it would allow to easier find files on systems where Paperwork isn't installed.
In addition it would allow to easily migrate away from Paperwork. Not that this would ever be needed ;).

events.target_title: [PDF import] Keep the file names

note.body:
I wouldn't worry to much about a user adding files to the folder.
I reckon most users will import the PDFs through Paperwork but would like to keep their naming system.
In my case:
YYYY-MM-DD_some_name.pdf
I wouldn't store any other files in the folder Paperwork creates I just would like to have useful filenames outside of Paperwork.
E.g. when using Nextcloud on my phone.
A hacky way would be to just look for *.pdf in a folder.
Sure that could break if there are more than one PDF but IMO better than nothing.

Could g_get_user_database_entry() and friends be moved to their own file for the benefit of statically linked applications?
Could g_get_user_database_entry() and friends be moved to their own file for the benefit of statically linked applications?

note.body:
Since we always use the distribution's glib, we don't have the option of building it ourselves. I don't think either Ubuntu or RedHat build their static glib libraries with those options.

If upstream glib think that a static glib should always be built like that, then it would probably be helpful for the build system to enforce it. That seems like it would be a lot more work than "just move these functions to a different source file", though...

events.target_title: Could g_get_user_database_entry() and friends be moved to their own file for the benefit of statically linked applications?

note.body: I'm not sure how 2 would work -- some end-users build QEMU from source against the distro glib, so unless we asked distros to ship an entire separate glib binary package set just for QEMU (which doesn't seem like it would fly) they'll still run into these warning messages.

events.target_title: Could g_get_user_database_entry() and friends be moved to their own file for the benefit of statically linked applications?

note.body:
We fully statically link (the use case is putting the QEMU binary into a foreign-architecture chroot which doesn't have the host-architecture libraries). This works fine as we don't use any of the name resolution or user database stuff, and we don't make glib calls that would use it indirectly.

The downside of always getting the warnings (apart from them just being noise in the build process) is that we can't tell if QEMU's code is really calling a glib function that actually does use the offending glibc functions, so we lose the benefit of getting warned if we accidentally do do something we shouldn't.

events.target_title: Could g_get_user_database_entry() and friends be moved to their own file for the benefit of statically linked applications?

Wacom Bamboo Pen & Touch doesn't get detected as an input device.

note.body:
Resolved for me the same problem with complete deinstallation of:
Wacom-driver Version 6.3.38-2.
Tablet WACOM Intuos pro PTH-660. 
Gimp 64bit 2.10.14
Next step:
new installation of WACOM driver Version 6.3.38-2.
new installation of Gimp 64bit 2.10.14

Now Gimp and Krita have access to the pressure sensitive WACOM Pen in the input devices. please enable them if necessary.

The original source of this issue is the continous update of Windows 10 and all drivers. it looks like overwritten files inside the system. may also be, that the used Tablet API for Windows 10 is now deprecated. for example the Corel Painter Essentials 4 was working without my modifications. WACOM has currently 2 pressure sensitivity levels. one (the old compatibility mode) is restricted to 1024 digits. the second is the new introduced pressure sensitivity with more digits (range is unknown for me).

Gimp crash on Edit-> Preferences

note.body:
Never had an issue with this in 2.10.8 then when I installed 2.10.14 today it started happening to me, but even more when I uninstall 2.10.14 and reinstall 2.10.8 the latter doesn't even load, but crashes as soon as it tries to open.

Afterwords I only got 2.10.8 to work again by deleting all GIMP files I could find, .gimp-2.8, the GIMP folder in AppData/Roaming, and all GIMP, GeGL, Babl, gtk data in AppData/Local, so it starts right now, but it now also produces the same fatal error while proceeding to edit->preferences, while before it wouldn't!

Is anyone aware of more GIMP produced folders I can delete? Or maybe even tell me how to manually search for any registries to even delete those, like Gegl, Bable registries if they exist? 
I also find that GIMP has saved my project history, so there are some preferences still being preserved somewhere.

Much thanks in advance.

Update:
Also exporting images fails right now, this is quite an evil bug.

events.target_title: Uninstall not removing all GIMP related files and preferences.
Gimp crash on Edit-> Preferences

note.body:
These are some crashdumps of what happened to me[gimp-2.10.exe.4900.dmp](/uploads/7abbeed301e719069b34dc80f333ea33/gimp-2.10.exe.4900.dmp)

[gimp-2.10.exe.4276.dmp](/uploads/e5f9ca68fd71e3d90bf2f7b8d1fa709b/gimp-2.10.exe.4276.dmp)

[gimp-2.10.exe.4964.dmp](/uploads/8ed64525f9d8207623d6ca71e115877f/gimp-2.10.exe.4964.dmp)

events.target_title: Gimp crash on Edit-> Preferences

note.body:
I've looked into the registry entries that are blatantly GIMP's and I found a lot, even for the old 2.8 version. I've run CCleaner on the registries a few times actually to get rid of as much as I can, the free version of CCleaner doesn't seem to recognize all of them in one scan. 
I got rid of most of them, but I was left with this one:

![HKEY_USERS1](/uploads/00c765e82407efd4860b5bac88a5dd43/HKEY_USERS1.png)

events.target_title: Gimp crash on Edit-> Preferences

note.body:
This bug is so pervasive that even after uninstalling GIMP and installing GLIMPSE it makes GLIMPSE crash with the same bug edit->preferences, but it made GLIMPSE crash even while creating a new canvas.

Note: 2.8 installs and works fine for me, except it doesn't open my recently created projects because the XCF file is too new, quite a turn off.

events.target_title: Uninstall not removing all GIMP related files and preferences.

note.body: The discussion about the fatal crash can be found at over [here](https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/gimp/issues/2846), and as you will see it also happens to GLIMPSE.

events.target_title: Gimp crash on Edit-> Preferences

note.body:
I'm running Windows 7 32 bits on a Intel Core i5 laptop with onboard Intel HD Graphics 3000.

Never had a problem until installing 2.10.14 build 3.

events.target_title: Uninstall not removing all GIMP related files and preferences.

note.body:
I can understand the wish to safe your personal files, but these are personal settings which are placed in a hidden folder, so at least I should be given the option to delete them, and they did produce a problem for me, so I had to manually go seek for them. 

2.10.8 was working nice for me, then 2.10.14 installed something which messed up a file which even GLIMPSE uses, so now none of these programs are working, and any uninstall should just give the option to reverse all that it installed.

But now I'm left with a rogue file or folder messing up my program, with no proper solution except deleting all windows files and installing windows anew. 
Some people might think this is a small thing, but I use GIMP because it is freeware, I don't want to use software without the consent of it's owner, which include Windows. 
So it means I have to go find someone willing to share his license with me so I can reinstall windows again legally.

So plz just give me the ability to delete all that it installed, even if it
where to be in a "Advanced" section.

events.target_title: Gimp crash on Edit-> Preferences

note.body: I have to ask if anyone who has this bug with 2.10, also had a bug in 2.8 with keyboard shortcuts like: ctrl+s, ctrl+c, ctr+v not working?

Afterwords I only got 2.10.8 to work again by deleting all GIMP files I could find, .gimp-2.8, the GIMP folder in AppData/Roaming, and all GIMP, GeGL, Babl, gtk data in AppData/Local, so it starts right now, but it now also produces the same fatal error while proceeding to edit->preferences, while before it wouldn't!

Is anyone aware of more GIMP produced folders I can delete? Or maybe even tell me how to manually search for any registries to even delete those, like Gegl, Bable registries if they exist? 
I also find that GIMP has saved my project history, so there are some preferences still being preserved somewhere.

Much thanks in advance.

Update:
Also exporting images fails right now, this is quite an evil bug.

events.target_title: Uninstall not removing all GIMP related files and preferences.

events.target_title: Gimp crash on Edit-> Preferences

note.body:
I've looked into the registry entries that are blatantly GIMP's and I found a lot, even for the old 2.8 version. I've run CCleaner on the registries a few times actually to get rid of as much as I can, the free version of CCleaner doesn't seem to recognize all of them in one scan. 
I got rid of most of them, but I was left with this one:

![HKEY_USERS1](/uploads/00c765e82407efd4860b5bac88a5dd43/HKEY_USERS1.png)

events.target_title: Gimp crash on Edit-> Preferences

note.body:
This bug is so pervasive that even after uninstalling GIMP and installing GLIMPSE it makes GLIMPSE crash with the same bug edit->preferences, but it made GLIMPSE crash even while creating a new canvas.

Note: 2.8 installs and works fine for me, except it doesn't open my recently created projects because the XCF file is too new, quite a turn off.

events.target_title: Uninstall not removing all GIMP related files and preferences.

note.body: The discussion about the fatal crash can be found at over [here](https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/gimp/issues/2846), and as you will see it also happens to GLIMPSE.

events.target_title: Gimp crash on Edit-> Preferences

note.body:
I'm running Windows 7 32 bits on a Intel Core i5 laptop with onboard Intel HD Graphics 3000.

Never had a problem until installing 2.10.14 build 3.

events.target_title: Uninstall not removing all GIMP related files and preferences.

note.body:
I can understand the wish to safe your personal files, but these are personal settings which are placed in a hidden folder, so at least I should be given the option to delete them, and they did produce a problem for me, so I had to manually go seek for them. 

2.10.8 was working nice for me, then 2.10.14 installed something which messed up a file which even GLIMPSE uses, so now none of these programs are working, and any uninstall should just give the option to reverse all that it installed.

But now I'm left with a rogue file or folder messing up my program, with no proper solution except deleting all windows files and installing windows anew. 
Some people might think this is a small thing, but I use GIMP because it is freeware, I don't want to use software without the consent of it's owner, which include Windows. 
So it means I have to go find someone willing to share his license with me so I can reinstall windows again legally.

So plz just give me the ability to delete all that it installed, even if it
where to be in a "Advanced" section.

events.target_title: Gimp crash on Edit-> Preferences

note.body: I have to ask if anyone who has this bug with 2.10, also had a bug in 2.8 with keyboard shortcuts like: ctrl+s, ctrl+c, ctr+v not working?

XF86Copy XF86Paste keys do nothing

note.body:
@jayarmstrong Would you mind sharing your Actiona script here? I'm affected by the same issue and I'm having a hard time to find an easy solution.

In any case I'm actually quite surprised that this is still a quirk in GTK in 2020. I remember this was already a bummer back in 2005. Is it really that much work to make use the XFxxx-Keys in GTK? There are so many applications that would benefit from working cut, copy and paste special keys.

events.target_title: gnome-software stuck looking for new updates

note.body:
I had similar behaviour: hanging in software, VT switch would stop it.

I also found that trying to update flatpak's by hand would hang. I nuked everything in flatpak with a `flatpak remove --all` and the update tab now loads. Correlation is not causation but maybe a pointer? :)

Mirror button on Displays screen gets text superimposed over icon with ru_XX.UTF8 locale
Delay on keyboard layout switching

note.body:
I confirm that this bug exists in gnome 3.34 (ububtu 19.10). It is extremely annoying due to two reasons:
- parts of the screen flicker on layout switching (in firefox, text field and scrollbars, in some cases whole window)
- productivity is greatly reduced since it is impossible to type fast. If you type fast, that part of the word that was typed during the delay will be silently omitted. You must wait for half-a-second or a second (subjective evaluation) after switching layout to make sure your typing will be copied.

Some sources recommend setting switcher-delay-time to -1 or -10: `gsettings set org.freedesktop.ibus.general switcher-delay-time -1`, but this seems to have no effect.

Gtk-CRITICAL during gtk_widget_draw on glade-generated
Gtk-CRITICAL during gtk_widget_draw on glade-generated

note.body:
Timm, thank you for your note.  

With a glade-generated UI is there ever a case where we would expect 'alloc_needed' to be set?  I am not creating any containers from scratch, nor am I doing any direct size_allocate() calls or gtk_widget_draw() calls.

It's certainly always possible this is a generic memory overwrite bug.  However, the only thing we are seeing is this 'alloc_needed' issue -- never any other crash or assertion or GTK_IS_WIDGET() failure (which I see is another check at the start of gtk_widget_draw()). 

Can you provide some debug options to generate more gtk output to figure out what the glade builder back-end is doing and why it might be in this bad state on some occasions?

events.target_title: Gtk-CRITICAL during gtk_widget_draw on glade-generated

note.body:
I wonder if this issue could be related:
https://source.puri.sm/Librem5/libhandy/issues/85

events.target_title: Gtk-CRITICAL during gtk_widget_draw on glade-generated

note.body:
Timm,

Understood that a widget needs to have a valid size -- but my understanding is that this is taken care of under the hood (I am not performing any size_allocate() calls).  Is there a time where the Glade-generated UI clears this flag between stack pages, for example, which may be related?

--

No, this project is not using libhandy, but it does seem to have some similar GTK usage.

For example this comment:
>>>
I've researched a bit, looks like GtkStack sets `gtk_widget_set_child_visible()` on both visible widgets during an animation and keeps them both allocated. The second widget is not drawn, it's snapshotted into a cairo surface just as in leaflet, but because the widget is actually allocated, it works reliably.
>>>

events.target_title: Gtk-CRITICAL during gtk_widget_draw on glade-generated

note.body: Understood -- anything you can suggest to try and debug further and/or generate additional debug output that could help diagnose the problem? I am no stranger to diving into the source code -- but I'm hoping to avoid spending too much time just finding what to look at.

events.target_title: Gtk-CRITICAL during gtk_widget_draw on glade-generated

note.body: Unfortunately, I don't have an easy way to install gtk from source -- it's part of a packaged embedded environment and I was hoping to take an initial stab at what the cause might be before digging into that significant effort.  If you don't have any other suggestions or guidance, we can just close this ticket.  I appreciate the responses, regardless.

events.target_title: Gtk-CRITICAL during gtk_widget_draw on glade-generated
Gtk-CRITICAL during gtk_widget_draw on glade-generated

note.body:
Timm, thank you for your note.  

With a glade-generated UI is there ever a case where we would expect 'alloc_needed' to be set?  I am not creating any containers from scratch, nor am I doing any direct size_allocate() calls or gtk_widget_draw() calls.

It's certainly always possible this is a generic memory overwrite bug.  However, the only thing we are seeing is this 'alloc_needed' issue -- never any other crash or assertion or GTK_IS_WIDGET() failure (which I see is another check at the start of gtk_widget_draw()). 

Can you provide some debug options to generate more gtk output to figure out what the glade builder back-end is doing and why it might be in this bad state on some occasions?

events.target_title: Gtk-CRITICAL during gtk_widget_draw on glade-generated

note.body:
I wonder if this issue could be related:
https://source.puri.sm/Librem5/libhandy/issues/85

events.target_title: Gtk-CRITICAL during gtk_widget_draw on glade-generated

note.body:
Timm,

Understood that a widget needs to have a valid size -- but my understanding is that this is taken care of under the hood (I am not performing any size_allocate() calls).  Is there a time where the Glade-generated UI clears this flag between stack pages, for example, which may be related?

--

No, this project is not using libhandy, but it does seem to have some similar GTK usage.

For example this comment:
>>>
I've researched a bit, looks like GtkStack sets `gtk_widget_set_child_visible()` on both visible widgets during an animation and keeps them both allocated. The second widget is not drawn, it's snapshotted into a cairo surface just as in leaflet, but because the widget is actually allocated, it works reliably.
>>>

events.target_title: Paperwork crashes when scanning from network printer
Do not create ~/papers by default

note.body: My papers directory is on a point, which I mount dynamically from an enfs folder (which syncs via dropbox). So when I start paperwork when the directory is not mounted, it will create the folder automatically. Then I have to delete the empty folder because the mounting is only possible into empty folders. That's a little bit clunky, perhaps a solution is simply to throw an error when the directory is not there and its not the default value (~/papers)?

events.target_title: GIMP 2.10.14 crashes (session?) after opening image
GIMP 2.10.14 crashes (session?) after opening image

note.body:
Hmm... After doing a bunch of research on how to produce a stack trace, the only relevant command I was able to find was: "snap run --strace="-tt -r" gimp 2>&1 | tee gimp_trace.log".  The resulting file is 18.5 MB, and I'm not sure if debugging symbols were enabled via the method I used.  Does this log file size sound about right?   There are many mentions of GIMP/the GIMP snap in the log.  Here is a [link](https://www.mediafire.com/file/8hjje01x7j37k54/gimp_strace.log/file) to download this log file.  I tried the methods on Gnome wiki regarding [capturing stack traces](https://wiki.gnome.org/Community/GettingInTouch/Bugzilla/GettingTraces/Details) with no avail.

When you mention having to install or compile debug symbols, is that some sort of system-wide package I need to find, or is it specifically built for snap/GIMP?  Please forgive me for my lack of knowledge in this area; I do try to do a fair bit of searching before I ask questions.  I'm pretty new to generating stack traces, etc.

Thanks,
Jared

events.target_title: GIMP 2.10.14 crashes (session?) after opening image
GIMP 2.10.14 crashes (session?) after opening image

note.body:
Hmm... After doing a bunch of research on how to produce a stack trace, the only relevant command I was able to find was: "snap run --strace="-tt -r" gimp 2>&1 | tee gimp_trace.log".  The resulting file is 18.5 MB, and I'm not sure if debugging symbols were enabled via the method I used.  Does this log file size sound about right?   There are many mentions of GIMP/the GIMP snap in the log.  Here is a [link](https://www.mediafire.com/file/8hjje01x7j37k54/gimp_strace.log/file) to download this log file.  I tried the methods on Gnome wiki regarding [capturing stack traces](https://wiki.gnome.org/Community/GettingInTouch/Bugzilla/GettingTraces/Details) with no avail.

When you mention having to install or compile debug symbols, is that some sort of system-wide package I need to find, or is it specifically built for snap/GIMP?  Please forgive me for my lack of knowledge in this area; I do try to do a fair bit of searching before I ask questions.  I'm pretty new to generating stack traces, etc.

Thanks,
Jared

events.target_title: GIMP 2.10.14 crashes (session?) after opening image
GIMP 2.10.14 crashes (session?) after opening image

note.body:
Hmm... After doing a bunch of research on how to produce a stack trace, the only relevant command I was able to find was: "snap run --strace="-tt -r" gimp 2>&1 | tee gimp_trace.log".  The resulting file is 18.5 MB, and I'm not sure if debugging symbols were enabled via the method I used.  Does this log file size sound about right?   There are many mentions of GIMP/the GIMP snap in the log.  Here is a [link](https://www.mediafire.com/file/8hjje01x7j37k54/gimp_strace.log/file) to download this log file.  I tried the methods on Gnome wiki regarding [capturing stack traces](https://wiki.gnome.org/Community/GettingInTouch/Bugzilla/GettingTraces/Details) with no avail.

When you mention having to install or compile debug symbols, is that some sort of system-wide package I need to find, or is it specifically built for snap/GIMP?  Please forgive me for my lack of knowledge in this area; I do try to do a fair bit of searching before I ask questions.  I'm pretty new to generating stack traces, etc.

Thanks,
Jared

events.target_title: GNOME Shell blanks screen immediately after retrieving Wifi connection from sleep (WPA supplicant)
GNOME Shell blanks screen immediately after retrieving Wifi connection from sleep (WPA supplicant)

note.body:
~~I was able to establish such a connection between the two problems by a) disabling Wi-Fi with `nmcli`, b) stopping WPA_Supplicant with `systemctl`, c) unloading the `ath10k_pci` driver, and then d) putting the device to sleep. Once the device was woken up, I was able to continue using it as normal. I then was able to reverse the process able (loading the Atheros driver, starting WPA_Supplicant, and enabling Wi-Fi) and the system did not blank the screen at all. I also observed that the logs from DBus were not present if I followed this method.~~

I'm going to retract this statement. The fix that I quoted above doesn't seem to work anymore, for whatever reason. I've attached the log from the latest boot: [export.log](/uploads/1d5e7b4c38f04a1effdc82ec75904f4d/export.log)

events.target_title: GNOME Shell blanks screen immediately after retrieving Wifi connection from sleep (WPA supplicant)
GNOME Shell blanks screen immediately after retrieving Wifi connection from sleep (WPA supplicant)

note.body:
~~I was able to establish such a connection between the two problems by a) disabling Wi-Fi with `nmcli`, b) stopping WPA_Supplicant with `systemctl`, c) unloading the `ath10k_pci` driver, and then d) putting the device to sleep. Once the device was woken up, I was able to continue using it as normal. I then was able to reverse the process able (loading the Atheros driver, starting WPA_Supplicant, and enabling Wi-Fi) and the system did not blank the screen at all. I also observed that the logs from DBus were not present if I followed this method.~~

I'm going to retract this statement. The fix that I quoted above doesn't seem to work anymore, for whatever reason. I've attached the log from the latest boot: [export.log](/uploads/1d5e7b4c38f04a1effdc82ec75904f4d/export.log)

events.target_title: Shortcut for leave room
Search Bar UX optimization:
Focus search entry when closing room with ESC when room list is filtered

note.body:
I like Slack's and revolt's approach more:
    1. leave the search bar open all the time and clear it on entering channel.  
    2. more minor fix: get rid of `ctrl+k` closing the search bar functionality so `ctrl+k` always enters search box. You should never need to press `ctrl+k` twice.

Additionally after search routine should be improved too:

Once search is entered going to the actual channel is awfully complicated. The current flow is: `ctrl+k` -> text -> tab -> enter. The problem with this flow it's designed for multiple search results, but in reality when switching chanels people know exactly where they want to go and most of the time just have 1 result.

    I propose that If there's one search result switch to it automatically or by cliking enter: 
    1. `ctrl + k` -> text -> if only 1 result: load it   
    2. `ctrl + k` -> text -> enter

Pressing tab when there's only 1 result is awfully redundant.

events.target_title: Shortcut for leave room

note.body:
@afranke I disagree with you here. Most of clients even from irc days have this functionality and Fractal even has a confirmation prompt! It's really awkward that you need to use 3 mouse clicks to leave a conversation.

Also what's the harm in having more shortcuts? It doesn't really get in the way.

events.target_title: Shortcut for leave room

note.body:
> quitting every time they are done with the current topic and recreating a new room with that same person the next time they want to talk to them. It leaves a trail of “empty rooms” and makes it harder to keep track of past conversations.

Do you suggest to keep chat open with every bot/person forever? What an absurd proposal - having hundreds of chats open that clearly serves no purpose. It's a __public__ communication platform but you interpret it as a private one.

Where does this notion that destructive actions shouldn't have shortcuts does even come from? There's a destructive button on your keyboard righ there, actually more than one.

I guess that's one way to kill any confidence in this projects. Thanks for clearing this up.

events.target_title: Slightly misleading documentation for the Sample Points

note.body:
I might be mistaken, but I think something went wrong when the sample points documentation was fixed. As @Ofnuts said, everything still works just fine in gimp 2.10 but you have to use the color picker tool in order to move or delete existing sample points. The current documentation states:

> This is no longer possible with GIMP-2.10: you can delete sample points using Edit/Undo (Ctrl+Z). 

which doesn't seem to make much sense in this context. What do you think?

note.body: Yes. For example, I will open one image in its own file and a second image in another file. I will crop image 2 using free-select tool (its a person's head and face). I will cut it, and it will cut out the selected outline. When I go to image 1 and paste it, it pastes it as a rectangle, including the area I am trying to crop out of the image. I have tried to use the ellipse tool instead, and the same thing happens where it adds in the cropped area. I am not sure if there is a setting that needs to be changed or something I am missing.

I have tried to use the ellipse tool instead, and the same thing happens where it adds in the cropped area. I am not sure if there is a setting that needs to be changed or something I am missing.

note.body:
Having the same problem on my company mail. Send folder is empty, however when I hover the mouse over the send folder it shows the correct number of messages which "should" be contained in the sent folder. Don't have this problem in Thunderbird, might have to switch back.

* Geary version and installation method: 3.34.1 OEM
* Your desktop: Gnome 3.34.2
* Your operating system and version Pop!_OS 19.10
* Email provider: company Novell acount
* Steps to reproduce the bug: add account and send email via Geary
* What happened? Nothing in sent folder
* What did you expect to happen? sent folder to show sent message after successful send

note.body:
>IN_MOVED_FROM (+)
>    Generated for the directory containing the old filename
>    when a file is renamed.
> 
>IN_MOVED_TO (+)
>    Generated for the directory containing the new filename
>    when a file is renamed.



http://man7.org/linux/man-pages/man7/inotify.7.html

note.body: It looks like the bookmark is updated if the file is renamed from within nautilus, but not if it's renamed with the mv command.

events.target_title: Shortcut/Bookmark to folder exists even if it was deleted.

note.body:
Hello, I wish I could have downloaded the newest version and confirmed this bug for you. I felt the onus was on the maintainers to do so for the following reasons:

Using a different distribution channel is non-trivial. Closing issues if reporters don't comply will cause a lot of legitimate reports to be ignored.
I am using the release published in Ubuntu 18.04 L(ong)T(erm)S(upport). This nautilus version was published merely 9 months ago.
The [relevant](https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/nautilus/blob/master/src/nautilus-bookmark-list.c)  [C files](https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/nautilus/blob/master/src/nautilus-bookmark.c) haven't been updated in over a year. 

I understand if this ultimately boils down to the typical resource constraints of free software development, if this is the case, I would be willing to help and confirm the bug in a newer version, but at that point I feel I should volunteer to triage other issues as well out of economies of scale and sense of duty.

note.body:
Hi Chun-wei Fan,

For sure with pleasure, I'm using the render function directly provided by the GtkGLArea signals

Here is the example i followed : https://developer.gnome.org/gtk3/stable/GtkGLArea.html

Specially the example with :

static gboolean
render (GtkGLArea *area, GdkGLContext *context)
{
...
}

Best regards

events.target_title: GtkGLarea : SIGSEGV, Segmentation fault

note.body:
Hi Chun-wei Fan,

I've been using gtk_gl_area_queue_render(area) where area is a GtkGLArea*, sorry i made a mistake in my explanations. Therefore i don't have any building error and the exe runs great but crashes few minutes after

Yes i disabled auto-rendering before calling gtk_gl_area_queue_render()

That's true it's curious but without a call to gtk_gl_area_queue_render() the render signal is emitted only one time even if auto-rendering is enable !

Due to this curious behavior, as you can see above i tried to replace the gtk_gl_area_queue_render() calling in the render() by an external triggerer coming from a GdkFrameClock but the result is the same...

events.target_title: gsd-housekeeping
gsd-housekeeping

note.body:
Following simlinks in /tmp ... /o\\\
/tmp is supposed to be wiped on reboot. period
If the user is a power-user/admin he can change that. If not, he does not need to change that.

For a workaround, there is a white-list for gsd plugins, configurable through dconf. I have white-listed none.

events.target_title: gsd-housekeeping

note.body:
For me, this bug has been present for at least 6 months, dates back to 3.32, maybe even 3.30 but I don't think so. I have spent a lot of time looking for the cause, before learning about the auditctl command, that told me what app was deleting my files.

Here is the version I use:
Installed Packages
Name         : gnome-settings-daemon
Version      : 3.34.2
Release      : 1.fc31
Architecture : x86_64
Size         : 5.3 M
Source       : gnome-settings-daemon-3.34.2-1.fc31.src.rpm

note.body:
> Does the XPM spec mention anything about how this should be handled?

I'm not sure. I couldn't find anything on whether it's valid or not to have unused colors on the palette, nor whether an unused **None** means anything special.

The **None** is being a problem for me as I'm loading it with SDL_image, that has a bug handling transparency ~ it makes white transparent if **None** is present on the palette.

pango based gnuplot terminals font issues on macos

note.body:
I came across similar issue when using librsvg to convert SVG to an image. Having a simple document:

```xml
<svg viewBox="-2.0 -5.0 16.0 9.0" width="480.0" height="270.0" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" version="1.1">
  <text font-size="2.0">This is a text</text>
</svg>
```

and rendering an image `rsvg-convert text.svg -o text.png` resulted in weird kerning:

![text_bad](/uploads/323f527c886c648f5c6a9655ed1ff65a/text_bad.png)

I noticed that it only happened when SVG's viewBox and text's font size were much smaller than document's dimensions. This led me to !120. When I disable rounding of glyph positions (by setting `context->round_glyph_positions = FALSE` in pango/pango-context.c), the final image looks better:

![text_ok](/uploads/9f1c4ad8719dc3d32ee12470a54fbc0c/text_ok.png)

I also verified that in 1.44.2 (before this change), the SVG was rendered correctly. Version 1.44.3 (which brought the changed rounding) and newer render the SVG incorrectly.

I am not familiar with Pango and unfortunately have no idea how to find the real cause. Hope this helps.

events.target_title: Ability to search in Nautilus and sort the results by column

note.body:
I truly can't believe how sorting can be removed from a search function. If you need use case, for which I now need to find a real file manager:

In around 2014 I installed a C library with around 2500 C files, in a herarcial folder structure. Then I found two bugs and fixed 4 files. In 2015 I installed an updated library hoping the bugs where officially fixed, but they where not, so I copied my fixed files back over the new library. At this point I was still using Win7 and finding the modified files where easy.

Today, in 2020, having moved to Linux 12 months ago: I don't know which folders or which files I edited any more, don't have the change date, and the modified files are neither newest nor oldest.
Use case: Find all C files in all the sub folders, SORT ACCORDING TO DATE to find the 4 files with dates not matching 99% of the other dates.

I mean, I can't even add the modified date column to the search results.

events.target_title: Geary can not send mail through smptp.office365.com (Ubuntu 18.04 LTS)
Geary can not send mail through smptp.office365.com (Ubuntu 18.04 LTS)

note.body:
My email address is indeed same as office365 & there is no way to get Geary 3.34 on Ubuntu 18.04. And it is same on Geary 3.34 (I checked on Ubuntu 20.04 dev)

But I figure out the problem. Having the smtp email id is not enough in this case. I had to use same email for `sender_mailboxes` under Account section in ~/.config/geary/<account>geary.ini which is surprising since imap doesn't require `sender_mailboxes` to be same as imap email id.

Help with pango 1.44 and bitmap font helvetica

note.body:
I would like to file a similar issue for my own bitmap font needs (Dina for terminals), can I suggest generalizing this issue to be:

"Document the bitmap font conversion process for end-users"

Since we're unfortunately having to ask end users and font authors to do this conversion, can we at least help them understand what they need to do, and how to do it?

events.target_title: Help with pango 1.44 and bitmap font helvetica

note.body: Incidentally, I ended up here because 1.44 is now in Ubuntu Focal development branch, which I'm dogfooding as a Canonical employee. As it gets wider attention, I expect another wave of users, developers and font authors to be searching around here trying to understand what's going on.

events.target_title: Help with pango 1.44 and bitmap font helvetica

note.body:
My specific problems with trying to convert Dina are:
* fontosfnt on my .fon files only includes the smallest font size in the output, and a distorted (erroneously emboldened) version of the 2nd smallest. Other sizes are lost.
* fontosfnt on my .bdf files gives no output, with the error "Couldn't select character map 6."
* fontforge (20190801, the latest release) on either my *.fon or *.bdf files produces output in which every character is blank.

Maybe these are due to previously-latent problems in the font itself? But I don't think so, because FontForge produces the same "all blank" output for other bitmap fonts too. (eg Proggy).

events.target_title: Help with pango 1.44 and bitmap font helvetica

note.body:
Turns out fontforge output is usable after all. It only produces invisible characters in font selection dialogs (both Tweaks' and Gnome-Terminal's). Once selected, by clicking around blindly on invisible previews, the fonts render well in gnome-terminal itself. (without the spacing issues other people have reported. Perhaps because this is a monospace font?)

There is some residual weirdness (e.g. selecting a size not defined in the bitmap font displays a blank terminal, rather than falling back to some other font), but they are things I can live with.

I still think you should document this process more prominently so everybody doesn't have to go through the same multi-hour process I just did, but I'm happy now.

note.body:
Hi Milan,
I can see your point of view on this.
I see it a bit differently for my use case though.
I agree creating a "New Meeting" (i.e. email invites etc) in the past doesn't make sense, however, this behaviour also occurs when creating a "New Appointment" (i.e. no provision for invites) which is  the default dialogue after double clicking a day box.

Every day I fill in my calendar for previous days as a record for what I did on those days. I'd suggest it's an inconsistent UX for clicking on a date to auto create a "New Appointment" but for this to pre-fill a different date to that selected depending on if it's a past or future date.

Just my 2 cents as a user. I respect if you want it marked as Expected Behaviour.
Thanks so much to you and the whole team. I really love Evolution! -  Iain

events.target_title: Cannot interact with Alacritty's CSD

note.body:
Hi, I'm the maintainer of [SCTK](https://github.com/Smithay/client-toolkit), the lib used internally by [winit](https://github.com/rust-windowing/winit) (and thus alacritty) to draw its decorations.

To give you all the context I have I can confirm that:

- SCTK uses subsurfaces placed outside the main window to draw decorations. There are 5 subsurfaces in total: one for the titlebar, and 4 transparent surfaces on all 4 sides for the resizing handles. (These 4 transparent subsurfaces may be enhanced as drop-shadows or something like that in the future.)
- the `set_window_geometry` is designed to include the main surface of the app and the titlebar subsurface, so that the transparent surfaces are not considered for window sizing, when tiling / maximizing.

events.target_title: Fonts with non-standard style names not recognized together
Fonts with non-standard style names not recognized together

note.body:
I'm not sure how common is this naming scheme for available fonts but note that:
* it is supported by the Windows OS and popular apps, such as Word, Paint, Adobe, LibreOffice, etc.
* There are no formal restraints regarding naming as there are at least 4 separate name fields in a font: Legacy family, legacy Style (restricted to Bold, Italic, Bold Italic, [Regular]), and also Preferred family, preferred style (these can be anything). GIMP does not respect this scheme.
* Font editors such as FontLab make it hard to output layered font families with a different naming scheme without manual edition of the exported font files.

events.target_title: Make it easier to support complex properties for custom widgets written in Python.

note.body:
I just encountered a similar problem ...

I would like to use some composite python defined widgets as custom widget in glade *and* in the
same time would like to use placeholders for these widgets (see https://developer.gnome.org/gladeui/stable/GladePlaceholder.html)

From my reading the old interface (using adaptors) as presented above is no more in use, we have now to use the "post-create-function" tag in order to modify the (auto-generated) widget adaptor :

```xml
<glade-widget-class name="FooFrobnicator" generic-name="frobnicator" title="Frobnicator"/>
  <post-create-function>foo_frobnicator_plugin_post_create</post-create-function>
  .....
  ....
```

(The previous xml comes from https://developer.gnome.org/gladeui/stable/widgetclasses.html.)

Problem is that it does not seem  possible to define such a function in python and then
make it accessible to glade, the error message is :

```
Could not find 'foo_frobnicator_plugin_post_create' in /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/glade/modules/libgladepython.so or in global namespace
```

events.target_title: Make it easier to support complex properties for custom widgets written in Python.

note.body:
The previous error message is emitted from the function `glade_xml_load_sym_from_node`defined
in `gladeui/glade-xml-utils.c` where the following fails :

```c
(g_module_symbol (module, buff, sym_location) ||
 g_module_symbol (self, buff, sym_location))
```

My understanding is that ̀ g_module_symbol` tries to find the function into the executable symbol table ... Is this really the case ?

events.target_title: Make it easier to support complex properties for custom widgets written in Python.

note.body:
See example here:

https://github.com/k-jm/python-glade-pb

DRM_FORMAT_XRGB2101010 dma buffer format is not handled causing mpv failure on Wayland with Iris Mesa's driver

note.body:
IIUC of the [comments](
https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/mutter/blob/e89cea8e5a9c944919cc0632b88bd68432778806/src/wayland/meta-wayland-dma-buf.c#L100). Short-circuiting XRGB to ARGB doesn't change the meaning of the operation since they are swizzling the channels but not accessing the content. Maybe also related to the discussions #323.

I've tested the following patch on 3.34 and the error is no more.

[mapXRGBtoARGB2101010.patch](/uploads/5a09f1f15a23abb15042e37487aa5b81/mapXRGBtoARGB2101010.patch)
